## Key Insights

- **Hook Handler Architecture**: The system uses a central registry pattern with default handlers for events like session-start, user-prompt-submit, and post-tool-use. Handlers demonstrate fail-open behavior (e.g., subagent-start/stop).
- **Observation Processing**: Post-tool-use handlers capture and filter tool usage data (excluding introspection/routing tools) for backend observation extraction.
- **Session Management**: Session-start handlers inject context from previous sessions and support SSE writers for real-time updates (e.g., CLAUDE.md).
- **Security & Urgency**: User-prompt handlers include secret detection (configurable redaction) and urgency detection based on keywords.
- **Proposed Improvements**: Recent work suggests migrating to a unified WebSocket system and evaluating database options (SQLite/PostgreSQL/libSQL) for production.
